author: Jaykul
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
```posh
trap{continue} 
.{[CmdletBinding()]param()  throw "ball" } -ErrorVariable E
$E.Count
```

Produces 1 error in `$E`

```posh
trap{continue} 
.{[CmdletBinding()]param() 
.{
throw "ball" 
}
} -ErrorVariable E
$E.Count
```

Produces 2 errors in `$E`


```posh
trap{continue} 
.{[CmdletBinding()]param() 
.{[CmdletBinding()]param() 
throw "ball" 
}
} -ErrorVariable E
$E.Count
```

Produces 3 errors in `$E`

And so on.

In other words, although one layer has no effect, each Callstack between the `throw` and the `catch` or `trap` adds another (duplicate) entry in the `ErrorVariable`, and each CmdletBinding adds another. Note that it doesn't matter if the scriptblocks are anonymous scriptblocks or named functions, or even module functions.


Expected behavior
-----------------
The `ErrorVariable` should only have one entry when only one exception is thrown,


Actual behavior
---------------
The `ErrorVariable` gets a copy of the error for each layer of nesting, and CmdletBinding adds another layer.

Environment data
----------------
Windows 10, PS 5.1 and even the latest alpha of 6

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSEdition                      Core
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              3.0
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.16
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
```
title: ErrorVariable gets duplicate errors for each nesting layer or CmdletBinding
